page.title: 05RELIGION IN POULTON
page.content: Religion plays a major role in the lives of many people in Poulton. There are four churches in Poulton;the largest and oldest is St. Chad's (C of E) which dates back to the 17th century. We also have a more modern Methodist church, built in 1965 which can seat 350 people. Opposite the Methodist church is the United Reformed Church and Congregational Chapel. The old church building is now used as a church hall. The Chapel seats over 200 people. The other church is the Catholic Church of English Martyrs on Highcross Road which holds three Sunday services and confessionals. All three Poulton churches have Men's societies, play schools and Sunday Schools. St. Chad's also has a bellringing team, which is much in demand for weddings.
